result.execSummary:
The defendant Shelly M Palmersheim was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

No Violent Contact with the victim listed in the criminal complaint. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. Defendant can apply for early termination of probation if all conditions have been met and with support of agent. 
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shelly M Palmersheim

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Notice of Case Status Change - Defendant Terminated Early
  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
Order terminating Probation early due to compliance with all conditions.
Dated May 20, 2016 filed by Department of Corrections requesting updating the Court on the Defendant's probation status.

Received today, from the Defendant to Judge Carter, requesting early termination of probation.
05/17, called Agent Olaciregui to request memo on his position regarding Defendant's request.

Defendant Shelly M Palmersheim in court with attorney Matthew Huppertz.  Barbara Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea to count #1. Court performs plea colloquy and finds defendant guilty of count #1. Count #2 is dismissed and read in. State gives sentencing recommendations. Victim makes statements. Atty Huppertz makes statements regarding sentencing. Defendant makes Statements. The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

COUNT#1:

WITHHELD:

TERM OF PROBATION: 1 YEAR

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____No contact violent with: victim listed in the Criminal Complaint.
____Defendant can apply for early termination of probation if all conditions have been met and with support of agent. 

COSTS:  $343.00 +$200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 12-04-2015 03:00 pm
Dated 11/10/15, from Atty Huppertz to Judge Carter, with attached letter/information for 12/04/15 plea/sentencing hearing.

Defendant Shelly M Palmersheim in court with attorney Matthew Huppertz.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Huppertz requests a plea and sentence date.  Court adjourns.    Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Plea hearing at 11-04-2015 10:30 am

Attorney Matthew Huppertz in court.   Defendant Shelly M Palmersheim did not appear.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Huppertz requests a plea hearing date.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on September 3, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
to appear filed by Atorney Matthew Huppertz

Attorney Matthew Huppertz in court.   Defendant Shelly M Palmersheim did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Attorney Huppertz requests a 45 day adjournment.    Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for September 3, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Atty Huppertz has been retained.
Filed by Atty Huppertz.
Hearing on July 6, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Defendant is not to have any violent contact with David V. listed in the criminal complaint.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.

Defendant Shelly M Palmersheim in court, in custody.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jorge Fragoso appears as friend of the court.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
